definition: to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to engage (a teacher etc)/to hire/to betroth/betrothal gift/to get married (of woman)

sentences.english: This year's graduates with major in Automation Control or Electrical Engineering are also welcome.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎優秀的自動化控制或機電工程應屆畢業生應聘。

sentences.english: Employment interview is the process of transferring information between interviewers and interviewees.
sentences.chinese: 面試是面試官與應聘者進行面對面交流的過程。

sentences.english: Xu believes that stress has become a common problem for employees.
sentences.chinese: 徐永革認爲應聘者普遍存在的問題是壓力。

sentences.english: Many employers also check whether potential hires can speak Mandarin.
sentences.chinese: 許多用人單位也會覈查應聘者是否會講普通話。

sentences.english: But actually I applied for the job twice to get it.
sentences.chinese: 但我實際應聘了兩次纔得到這份工作。

sentences.english: During a phone interview the candidate flushed the toilet while talking to hiring manager.
sentences.chinese: 應聘者在一次電話面試外邊和招聘經理談話邊衝馬桶。

sentences.english: Do you think I'm in with abetter chance now?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲現在我應聘這個職位會成功嗎？

sentences.english: Small nan, the relationship between friends to apply for.
sentences.chinese: 小楠託朋友的關係，前去應聘。

sentences.english: I want to apply for a job which will enable me to use my knowledge of computer.
sentences.chinese: 我想要應聘一個能保證我運用電腦知識的工作。

sentences.english: Secondly, an interviewee must demonstrate his skills for the job.
sentences.chinese: 其次，應聘者要證明自己能勝任這份工作。

sentences.english: I am writing this letter Apply your company's recruiting assistant manager position.
sentences.chinese: 俺寫此信應聘貴公司招聘的經理助理職位。

sentences.english: There were more than twenty piano companies in Beijing at that time, and she applied for a position as a temporary employee.
sentences.chinese: 那時北京有二十多家琴行，她就一家一家上門去應聘。

sentences.english: They won't waste it listening to the interviewees' twaddle.
sentences.chinese: 他們不會把時間浪費在應聘人的閒談上。

sentences.english: “This also helps you become a better interviewee, ” Richards says.
sentences.chinese: 這可以幫助你成爲一個更好的應聘者”，理查茲說。

sentences.english: I saw your ad* in the paper and wanted to apply for the job.
sentences.chinese: 我看到你們在報紙上登的廣告想來應聘這個工作。

sentences.english: The applicant smelled his armpits on the way to the interview room。
sentences.chinese: 應聘者聞着腋窩走進面試房間。

definition: to apply (for a job)/to reply to a job advertisement
to hold an office or post
to enter oneself for an examination
specialty/specialized field/main field of study (at university)/major/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]/professional
to retire/to leave office/to quit a job
